item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Oriah Mountain Dreamer
item.description: "It doesn't interest me what you do for a living. I want to know what you ache for, and if you dare to dream of meeting your heart's longing. It doesn't interest me how old you are. I want to know if you will risk looking like a fool for love, for your dream, for the adventure of being alive. It doesn't interest me what planets are squaring your moon. I want to know if you have touched the center of your own sorrow, if you have been opened by life's betrayals or have become shriveled and closed from fear of further pain!I want to know if you can sit with pain, mine or your own, without moving to hide it or fade it, or fix it. I want to know if you can be with joy, mine or your own, if you can dance with wildness and let the ecstasy fill you to the tips of your fingers and toes without cautioning us to be careful, to be realistic, to remember the limitations of being human. It doesn't interest me if the story you are telling me is true. I want to know if you can disappoint another to be true to yourself; if you can bear the accusation of betrayal and not betray your own soul; if you can be faithlessand therefore trustworthy. I want to know if you can see beauty even when it's not pretty, every day,and if you can source your own life from its presence. I want to know if you can live with failure, yours and mine, and still stand on the edge of the lake and shout to the silver of the full moon, “Yes!” It doesn't interest me to know where you live or how much money you have. I want to know if you can get up, after the night of grief and despair, weary and bruised to the bone, and do what needs to be done to feed the children. It doesn't interest me who you know or how you came to be here. I want to know if you will stand in the center of the fire with me and not shrink back. It doesn't interest me where or what or with whom you have studied. I want to know what sustains you, from the inside, when all else falls away. I want to know if you can be alone with yourself and if you truly like the company you keep in the empty moments." -- Oriah Mountain Dreamer

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "To love another person is to see the face of God." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Truth is on the side of the oppressed." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "He loved her, of course, but better than that, he chose her, day after day. Choice: that was the thing." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "A society has no chance of success if its women are uneducated..." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "Be peaceful, be courteous, obey the law, respect everyone; but if someone puts his hand on you, send him to the cemetery." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you have no critics you'll likely have no success. " -- Malcolm X

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "Marriage can wait, education cannot." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He who opens a school door, closes a prison." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Poetry = Anger x Imagination" -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Reason is intelligence taking exercise. Imagination is intelligence with an erection." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you're not ready to die for it, take the word 'freedom' out of your vocabulary." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "You who suffer because you love, love still more. To die of love, is to live by it." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Opportunities multiply as they are seized." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun tzu
item.description: "All warfare is based on deception. Hence, when we are able to attack, we must seem unable; when using our forces, we must appear inactive; when we are near, we must make the enemy believe we are far away; when far away, we must make him believe we are near." -- Sun tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "When strong, avoid them. If of high morale, depress them. Seem humble to fill them with conceit. If at ease, exhaust them. If united, separate them. Attack their weaknesses. Emerge to their surprise." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Supreme excellence consists of breaking the enemy's resistance without fighting." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Let your plans be dark and impenetrable as night, and when you move, fall like a thunderbolt." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Build your opponent a golden bridge to retreat across." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "The art of war is of vital importance to the State. It is a matter of life and death, a road either to safety or to ruin. Hence it is a subject of inquiry which can on no account be neglected." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "When the enemy is relaxed, make them toil. When full, starve them. When settled, make them move." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "When one treats people with benevolence, justice, and righteoousness, and reposes confidence in them, the army will be united in mind and all will be happy to serve their leaders'." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "There is no instance of a country having benefited from prolonged warfare. " -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "It is the rule in war, if our forces are ten to the enemy's one, to surround him; if five to one, to attack him; if twice as numerous, to divide our army into two." -- Sun Tzu

item.title: Malcolm add a quote by Sun Tzu
item.description: "In war, then, let your great object be victory, not lengthy campaigns." -- Sun Tzu
